newsitem.title: JAPAN: JR East to sell electricity -- paper.
newsitem.headline: JR East to sell electricity -- paper.

text.p: East Japan Railway Co (JR East) plans to boost the capacity of its electric power generators by more than 10 percent in the spring of 1999 and to begin selling electricity, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Friday.
The company will initially sell the electricity to other JR East group firms, but also hopes to participate in auctions for supplying electricity to power companies in the future, the paper said.
Japanese deregulation measures in December 1995 allowed companies to sell electric power generated at their own facilities.
A spokesman for JR East said he could not immediately confirm the Nihon Keizai report.
However, he also said that the company had not made a final decision whether it would enter the electricity business.
